text: Earendel, technically WHL0137-LS, is the most-distant known single star. Its name comes from Aurvandill ("Morning Star" in Old English). Its image was captured by the Hubble Space Telescope. The star was observed through a gravitational lens. It has a redshift. Light from the star was emitted 900millionyears after the Big Bang, and took 12.9billionyears to travel to Earth. ==References== Category:Stars
title: Earendel
